lead_paragraph: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts Amherst.
snippet: Increases in minimum wages had no negative effects on low-wage employment and successfully increased the income of workers in food services and retail employment, an economist writes, citing a new study.
abstract: Increases in minimum wages had no negative effects on low-wage employment and successfully increased the income of workers in food services and retail employment, an economist writes, citing a new study.
